item.title: Cross-Protocol Chained Pass the Hash for Metasploit
item.author: mubix
item.description: Every so often someone writes a Metasploit Module that is pretty epic. Today is one such day: Twitter Link: https://twitter.com/webstersprodigy/status/222529916783169536 Which has a link to here: https://github.com/rapid7/metasploit-framework/pull/589 Demo / Example resource files: https://skydrive.live.com/?cid=19794fac33285fd5&resid=19794FAC33285FD5!170&id=19794FAC33285FD5%21170 You can pull the fork w/ branch from here: https://github.com/webstersprodigy/metasploit-framework/tree/module-http-ntlmrelay And as soon as you do you can start doing this (using the example resource file to put a file, cat it out, enum shares available, list files on a share, then psexec all from a single URL being loaded):

item.title: MS08_068 + MS10_046 = FUN UNTIL 2018
item.author: mubix
item.description: TL;DR: SMB Relay + LNK UNC icons = internal pentest pwnage I need to touch on the highlights of two vulnerabilities before we talk about the fun stuff, but I highly encourage you to read the references at the bottom of this post and understand the vulnerabilities after you are done with my little trick, as you might find one of your own. MS08_068: http://www.cvedetails.com/cve/CVE-2008-4037/ In 2008, Microsoft released MS08_068 which patched the “SMB Relay” attack.
